title: How to Make Tofu Cream

steps.headline: Place all of the ingredients into a mixing bowl.
Whisk or whip the mixture until it turns smooth.
steps.description: Cover the bowl with plastic food wrap or a lid when done.

steps.headline: Place in the refrigerator to chill.
steps.description: Keep there for at least one hour, or until the cream firms.

steps.headline: Use as needed.
steps.description: The tofu cream should be kept refrigerated until used, and used within 2 days of being made.

steps.headline: Add the ingredients to either a food process or a blender.
steps.description: Process or blend until a smooth and creamy mixture forms.

steps.headline: Transfer to a mixing bowl.
steps.description: Place a cover or lid over the bowl.

steps.headline: Place in the refrigerator to chill.
steps.description: Leave for a few hours to firm properly, so that it acts like whipped cream.

steps.headline: Serve in a dish or add to items as needed.
Soak the cashews a day ahead of preparing this recipe.
steps.description: Place into a large bowl and pour the water over the top, to cover. Set aside to soak overnight. The next day, drain the soaked cashews and put them to one side.

steps.headline: Wrap the tofu in paper towels.
steps.description: Place onto a cutting board, then place something heavy on top, such as an iron skillet or a pan with cans placed insider. Leave to press for 10 minutes. This pressing removes excess water drain out of the tofu, which is needed for this recipe.

steps.headline: Remove the paper towels from the wrapped tofu.
steps.description: Toss the towels away (they compost well). Wrap in a clean kitchen cloth. Use your hands to squeeze out even more water over the sink.

steps.headline: Cut the tofu block into chunks.
steps.description: Toss these into the blender. Add the soaked cashews, water, lemon juice, vinegar and sugar. Add the salt to taste. Blend or process the ingredients from a low to a high speed as the ingredients begin to break down and mix. Blend or process for around 2 minutes, until a smooth paste forms. You may need to stop the processor or blender occasionally and stir around with a spoon, spatula or tamper; do not use fingers! Stir a little, then resume processing or blending. Test to see that all ingredients have been blended before removing the mixture.

steps.headline: Remove from the blender and transfer to a dish.
steps.description: Check the flavor. This can be further seasoned with spices/spice blends, lemon juice, capers, onion pieces, pepper blends, and so forth. It can be used immediately or stored in a lidded glass jar until needed later.

steps.headline: Place the ingredients into the food blender or processor.
steps.description: Blend or process until the ingredients are smooth.

steps.headline: Water down if needed.
steps.description: If the consistency needs to be thinner, add the additional water or lemon juice.

steps.headline: Remove from the appliance.
steps.description: Transfer to a serving bowl or use in a recipe as needed.
